name: writeDump
syntax: writeDump(var [, expand] [, format] [, abort] [, hide] [, keys] [, label] [, metainfo] [, output] [, show] [, showUDfs] [, top])
description: Outputs the elements, variables and values of most kinds of CFML objects. Useful for debugging. You can display the contents of simple and complex variables, objects, components, user-defined functions, and other elements. Equivalent to the cfdump tag, useful in cfscript.

params.name: var
params.description:
Variable to display. Enclose a variable name in pound
 signs.

params.name: expand
params.description: Yes: In Internet Explorer and Mozilla, expands views

params.name: format
params.description: specify whether to save the results of a cfdump to a file in text or HTML format

params.name: abort
params.description: Boolean value to immediately abort after displaying the dump.

params.name: keys
params.description: For a structure, number of keys to display.

params.name: label
params.description: A string; header for the dump output.

params.name: metainfo
params.description: Includes information about the query in the cfdump results.

params.name: output
params.description: Where to send the results of cfdump.

params.name: top
params.description: The number of rows to display.

lucee.notes: In Lucee there is a shortcut. Simply use `dump()`
